website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy keyboard featuring high-end (and loud) keys, as well as a great look.
pros: This keyboard stands out for its brushed aluminum look and high-end Blue switches
Many also note that it cleans up easily
If you think a keyboard should be loud, this is the option for you
cons: Some complain that this keyboard is too loud (something you can easily fix by adding your own O-rings)

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the keyboard at first. I really did! The build quality seemed solid, it's mechanical, it's comfortable to type on, and the price was right. The aluminum top gave it a quality feel. But I bought the keyboard in April, and by July several of the LEDs are dimming, which wasn't an issue I cared about. But the space bar is losing sensitivity and dropping keys, makingmytypinglooklikethis at random times. This is unacceptable. A mechanical keyboard's keys should not start failing in three months!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 7 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I received this keyboard March 9, 2017. This week the week of May 15, 2017, this keyboard started having issues turning on. As of today May 18th this keyboard is no longer working. I enjoyed this keyboard when it was working however this keyboard only lasted 7 weeks thus the 1 star rating. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: arod

customer_reviews.title: Almost but needs work to be good
customer_reviews.text: It types well. Really it does. It’s comfortable to use too. The keyboard itself isn’t the problem. The problem is the USB connector. Something about it isn’t quite right and with time it works loose and I’ve made enough attempts with connecting and reconnecting it and trying different ports to know it’s the USB connector on the ketboard’s cable. So if I’m doing something that just can’t be interrupted, out comes the sad little keyboard that it was supposed to replace.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: works better than some keyboards that are at a higher price point
customer_reviews.text: i returned another keyboard because its ghosting ability was nearly non-existent. this keyboard is just as good, and actually better in some ways, for much less. im at about 75wpm transcription, not gaming, and this keyboard does very well in keeping up. we also have a couple of these for medium data entry at the pharmacy where i work, and we are very pleased with Eagletec... the pharmacy keyboards have been going strong for about three years... my home office keyboard for about two or three months. will definitely consider reordering when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: A very nice mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very responsive and was super easy to get used to my only gripe is that the clicks are really loud you get used to it pretty quick and it is the loudest right out of the box if you are looking for something for work that won't disturb others than this is not the one to get but other than that its great backlights are good and the keyboard doesn't pick up fingerprints the font is a little annoying too but i got used to that pretty quick as well if your looking for a mechanical keyboard that is cheap this gets the job done pretty well for the price
customer_reviews.author: Jenn818

customer_reviews.title: keyboard worked great for about 8 months
customer_reviews.text: keyboard worked great for about 8 months, which is on par with that others have said. the WAS and D keys are now super hit-and-miss on whether or not it works. which makes sense that it's these keys since i use this keyboard for gaming. i don't know what the expected keystroke life is on the keys, but it is possible that i've exceeded that in the given time. i play games for maybe 15 to 20 hours a week (mostly Overwatch), sometimes more, sometimes less, if that helps anyone put the 8 month lifespan into perspective. i'd still say it's a solid keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Myers

customer_reviews.title: Clicky switches, sort of
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad keyboard overall for the price, the size and layout are good and the metal top is nice. Very solid. Very noisy of course, but turns out it's for no good reason unless you just like the noise. The feel is a bit mushy, tactile feedback is weak. The loud click and feel doesn't quite correspond with the point of electrical contact, which makes a much quieter click. So it's not the actual switch contacts making the loud click. You can let a key up partway and push it down again and it will register another keystroke without the loud click.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sayers

customer_reviews.title: keys come with blue background color
customer_reviews.text: What i like. I like the blue background. Good feel when hitting the keys what i dont like no manual included. I go to the website as directed but i dont see my model number listed under the keyboard. ET-KG010 none of the manuals listed have that model number the manual is one sheet of paper ...google ET-KG010 and you will find it. ergos are great gaming i dont know sleep mode i have no clue..ive never used that feature before. im sure this is a fine machine but it wont be until i get a manual and read it.
customer_reviews.author: namrats

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard arrived when expected. Packaging was reasonable for product. Keyboard works as expected. I like that I can turn the light on and off by pressing FN + ScrLk. The keys make a definite click when used and I don't get hand cramps using the keyboard. Keys are easy to read and don't appear to be subject to the characters being rubbed off. I consider myself a lite gamer, heavy office program user (Word + Excel) and internet surfer/researcher/tasker. I can easily pass hours away using my computer. The easier the keyboard is to use the less likely I am to be aware of time flying by.
customer_reviews.author: NLWPS of Amherst

customer_reviews.title: Multiple keys stopped working after just one month of use
customer_reviews.text: When this keyboard first showed up, I was really happy with it. The switches have great action, the baseplate is solid, and it has a nice clean look that avoids going down the "gamer aesthetic" rabbit hole. Today, however, the right arrow key and number pad zero key stopped working for seemingly no reason. The keyboard has been sitting on my desk, clean and dry, since the day I opened it. I do a lot of work in Excel, and those two keys are essential to quickly navigate cells and punch in numbers. I'm pretty disappointed, but not entirely surprised given the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Monty Jones

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I had the keyboard for about 1 year. Then a key broke off. Something I never expected with a "sturdy" mechanical keyboard. the small piece that holds the key to the switch split. I tried gluing it, but it wouldn't work after. Hard to use a keyboard without the letter "E". I lights up and I liked they strong backlight, although I had to leave it on all the time because there is no obvious way to turn it off. Would have been 4 or 5 stars before it broke. One year is way past the return policy. You probably want to find something with a longer warranty.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: "Bang for the buck" applies here
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to argue with this thing for the money. The keys are probably closest to a cherry blue switch though the break point is a little higher. They are very "clicky." If you are looking for a quiet keyboard then just stop reading and keep searching. I personally wanted the loud click and knew that was exactly what I was going to get. They have good feedback and the consistent key feel that you expect from a mechanical keyboard. The keys appear to be individually backlit and it can be turned off easily. I wish one of the function keys was a sleep button but that's about the only complaint I have which is very minor given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bigddybn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: First keyboard arrived, however the Caps Lock key did not work intermittently. I contacted Amazon's customer service and they issued a return label and refund, and changed the shipping speed on my replacement order to one day. When the second keyboard arrived, the badge at the top isn't completely glued down and is "bubbling", and the front left of the keyboard (the metal "overhang"), is bent. The keys seem functional though, so I'm not going to press my luck for another replacement. Disappointing for the price, since I have a $26 mechanical keyboard at work that is in much better shape and has worked perfect since day one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feel to the keys
customer_reviews.text: I tend to rest my fingers on the keys of a keyboard when typing and strike many keys unintentionally because of it. With the long "throw" of these keys, and the positive action, that isn't an issue for me on this keyboard. I've also discovered that I "hunt" for the keys...I need to see the character in order to type it. With the lighting of the keys provided by this keyboard, I can type much better in subdued lighting. It's a bit noisy, and very special-purpose, but for me, it's a major improvement over soft-touch keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Harkens back to the IBM Model M keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I have hunted and hunted for a keyboard half as good as the rugged IBM Model M keyboard from 30+ years ago. Until now, that hunt was in vain. This keyboard is as close as you're going to find today. The keys don't have as much tactile feedback that the Model M did, but this has more than any other modern keyboard I've found. I don't know what keys this uses, but they seem better than any of the Cherry keys I've tried. I love this keyboard! But, I decided to get the 4 year warranty based on the reviews that said the keyboard died on them.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off randomly after six months of use
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the keyboard, I liked it. Good action it worked well. But now about six month from the purchase date and the keyboard seems to be randomly shutting down on its own. I can usually tell when it happens because the backlight shuts off. This forces me to restart my computer, which can be really annoying. I haven't noticed any kind of a pattern, it appears to occur randomly. So far it works again after a reboot. It's a bit of a shame, because I generally like it otherwise. I am not in the market of another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Raskolnikov

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! Bought a second one for my other computer. This has the loud clicking of my old Northgate Omni-Key keyboards from years ago, which means it has that "positive tactile feedback" I've been missing on those soft, squishy, toy-like modern keyboards. This one is a TANK! Metal base plate is open and simple to clean. I use it for writing and editing, and it doesn't go accidentally into weird macro modes like other gamer boards do. So I never have to worry about what's being keyed into the file while I'm reading my notes or otherwise not watching the screen. I like the soothing blue, too, so here you have one satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and good price!
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described! Blue backlit mechanical keyboard! Good price for someone on a budget. Really fun typing on it. The keyboard even has a little stand if you want to use it! Gaming, I've noticed that the buttons require a bit more pressing than I'm used to on my old keyboard, but that's not a problem. The only issue I have is that when I'm typing I hear the little clanging noise of the springs, but it's really quiet, so I only notice it at night. Overall, very satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective keyboards in a row.....
customer_reviews.text: Had a problems with my first keyboard... send it back for a replacement. problems with my second keyboard...... Now the keyboard has potential, but so far i haven't seen anything positive, Fist one came damaged and the second one came damaged.
customer_reviews.author: yar Law

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems with the keyboard for the first couple of years and then in the third year the right arrow key stopped working. The keyboard was never abused and nothing was ever spilled on it (I also never cleaned it by putting it under the faucet though the listing contains a picture of that very thing). As another reviewer pointed out, the non-functioning key actually may not be with the switch itself but rather a problem with the PCB and/or controller.
customer_reviews.author: Am_Buyer

customer_reviews.title: and not that terrible backwards L enter key and half length backspace key)
customer_reviews.text: I've looked for a very long time to replace my nearly indestructable IBM buckling spring keyboard. This is so far the closest to that feel. The solid "click" allows me to type without looking and KNOWING I've hit the right keys. I was a little apprehensive to find a "mechanical" keyboard for less than 100$. This is a very simple layout (with the horizontal backspace/enter/shift, and not that terrible backwards L enter key and half length backspace key). Also to note, the "custom" switches feel and look an awefully lot like the Cherry MX Blue switches. I can't confirm if they are indeed manufactured by Cherry, but I can't find a reason to complain about them if they're not.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Starzer

customer_reviews.title: Great light up keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I often work in a darkened room, hence the need for a backlit keyboard. I really like this keyboard; the blue color back light is easy on the eyes, yet bright enough to be seen clearly. I also like the large characters on the keys, as it makes them easier to see. Being a mechanical keyboard, it is just a bit noisy, but the keys have a good feel and feedback to them, so I am ok with this. I am very satisfied with this keyboard, and I recommend it (I do not use it for gaming, FYI, just typing).
customer_reviews.author: The Gann Man

customer_reviews.title: YOUR SEARCH IS OVER!
customer_reviews.text: Story time... There once was a keyboard called the IBM 101. It was one of the best keyboards ever made. Unfortunately they are hard to find and it uses a very antiquated input. I have been typing for decades - this keyboard by far is the best experience I've had. You love that ultimate clicky sound and feel - this is the keyboard for you. Id put this keyboard up against any $100+ mechanical keyboards. Dump those thin keyed chick-let keyboards and feel what its like to REALLY type!
customer_reviews.author: Vaporjoes LLC

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later I have dead keys
customer_reviews.text: It's been a great keyboard but this past week I've had an entire group of keys decide they're no longer working. I doubt there's any kind of return policy this far out but it's something to be aware of if you're thinking on buying one of these. I see far more people not having issues but the issues do need to be reported.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pofahl

customer_reviews.title: I use it for work!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. I am on the computer 10 - 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. It is far superior to anything else I have used. I am somewhat a heavy when I type, and this holds up! The light up keys are great (the "E" key is not as bright as the others). I receive compliments all day long on this keyboard. My coworkers are wanting to replace theirs with this as well.... I suggest you buy one and stop using the other styles that are out there that do not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I miss the iron typewriters of the 1940s, IMB selectrics, and keyboards of my IBM ATs. I hated the electric Corona and similar portable and desk electric typewriters of the 1970s. I'm a diehard mechanical typist who also wants modern conveniences like backlighting, etc. This EagleTec KG010 is the typing feel and registery that is more familiar to me. I now type with the blind feel, staccato speed, error free correctness, and mindless satisfaction as I remember of decades ago. For the price, I bypassed the spartan and more expensive IBM copyright clone keyboards. This definitely proved being a good buy. to be fair, I've not tried the IBM clones.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Lam

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard quality is good enough to look over the small damage on the product.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard today, and it is enough good to give 5 stars. The backlight of the keyboard is suitable for me, and I feel good tactile when I press the keys every time. This is my second time to use the mechanical keyword, and compared to the previous keyboard (TOMOKO Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 104 keys), this keyboard gives more smooth feel when I am typing. However, the keyboard delivered with damage on the left side plate. I pulled back damaged part with my ranch, and it doesn't bother me anymore, but I think it is better to take care of delivery or packaging at the first time. So, I subtract one star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eagletec KG010 Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Thought a lot before buying this keyboard but now that I have it, I love it. Love the blue backlight, the feel and sound of the keys. This is not a quiet keyboard but I did not want that, I wanted some noise. There is a lot of room under the keys for dust and dirt to get trapped over time but I cover it when I am not using it and I keep food away from it. We shall see how this lasts over time, for now, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shem

customer_reviews.title: If you like the tactile feel and sound of the older original IBM keyboard, this is a great choice
customer_reviews.text: If you miss the old IBM keyboards from the early 90s as a coder, this is a great choice. The selectable levels of Illumination are nice including a completely off setting. The LEDs for numlock Etc are entirely too bright, but otherwise it has the tactile feel and that very distinctive mechanical clicking noise that some of us miss very much. I am not a gamer so I cannot comment on that aspect, but as a coder, I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Razer Black widow, if you think this keyboard is noisy you wouldn't want the black widow, anyway, looks cool works well, i guess ill see how long it lasts, my biggest complaint for amazon is, if the product is 10% off it should be automatic, i clicked the 10% off when i placed the order but still got charged full price, if you can afford it get the 3 year protection plan for 5.99..........
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: It looked so good I got one for myself
customer_reviews.text: The wife bought the white with the rainbow LEDs (KG010-RGB). It looked so good I got one for myself. Black with Blue LEDs (KG010). The base is plastic but the metal top plate makes the entire keyboard feel very solid. They keys feel amazing and satisfying with every click. The KG010-RGB so many customization options for the color. At least 18 presets and you can define your own patterns.The basic model I had, KG010, has settings for breathing lights but nowhere near as nice as the RGB model. This keyboards were a super sweet buy!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Klozof

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months of use, the F1 key stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I use my keyboard for gaming and typically am very good to my keyboards, my last one lasted me 5 years. After 6 months the F1 key on this thing stopped working, it clicks, I've tried everything but it just doesn't register as a button anymore... I probably wont' be buying another one of these. It's sad because i wanted to love it!
customer_reviews.author: f0rgiv3n

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT! Must have gaming accessory with a price and quality that will make your decision easy.
customer_reviews.text: I have used several $100+ mechanical keyboards, most of them Logitech and Corsair. While features vary between boards, the quality of the KG010 is right up there with the more expensive and better known manufacturers. The back-lighting looks and works great, the feel and responsiveness of the keys is satisfying, and the board feels solid. The only criticisms I could level are the two screws at the top of the board would have looked better if they were flushed (subjective) and the brightness settings do not stick on boot up. This is one of the budget options I recommend using so you have more to invest in things you get more of a benefit from, like graphics cards and monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Keypress action isn't quite as nice as a model M, but it's half the price and responds better.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard with good responsiveness. I like the aluminum underplate, as well. Coming from a Unicomp buckling-spring keyboard (updated model M), I'd say the keypress isn't quite as nice but that's a quibble. It's half the price of a Unicomp and the responsiveness is worlds better-- it doesn't have any startup lag like Unicomps do and its rollover behavior is worlds better. (Compared to a buckling-spring keyboard, the keypress -depth- is less, which means your fingers will bottom out on the keypress more. This is common for most mechanical keyswitches, though.)
customer_reviews.author: daggar

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work out
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard sits too high to be comfortable to use because of the raised keys. The back lighting flickers every few seconds, which is really distracting and annoying. The heavy "click" of the keys may be attractive to some folks, but the additional clatter is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with solid build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard with solid build quality. I had never owned a mechanical keyboard before so I wasn't prepared for the level of clickity-clackity-ness (technical term, don't worry about it) that was about to be unleashed upon me and my humble home office. I loved the feel and feedback of the mechanical keys but just could not get used to the noise (even with added o-ring dampeners). I ultimately returned the keyboard because I couldn't get used to the noise but if you are in the market for a solid, well built mechanical keyboard, this would be a great option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Horner

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: been using this for 3 months now. I love the response and how fast I can type on it. 1 down side is even though my office is a bit out of the way others can sometimes hear me typing. It's a little loud to say the least. The other downside is the shape of the ctrl key and location. I seem to hit it with the left side of my left palm while typing "A" and selecting all and erasing everything with the next key hit.
customer_reviews.author: billgod

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic keyboard for those who love the tactile feedback, which it has a lot of. It is loud, but that's because it is a mechanical keyboard. The Blue switches are one of the loudest, so it comes as no surprise that it is a loud keyboard. For the cost, it is one of the best that I have come across. It is very similar in design to the Corsair keyboard, and in fact, it looks almost identical, except that this keyboard doesn't include a volume control wheel in the top right corner and the logo, of course. I would highly recommend this keyboard if you are in to mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Eledium

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. My first mechanical keyboard, and I never know what I was missing. I am a full time online student that typing is 90% of my courses. This keyboard is a blessing to both my wrists (though I recommend a gel wrist pad) and has increased my typing speed by at less 10 works per minute easy. The heavy design makes the board set in place throughout the day. I had a problem with my cats knocking my keyboard off my desk often, this one hasn't moved! It is a bit clickly-clack, but if you get into what you are writing it is a so sweet. I even like the feel of the key tops.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Myers

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard makes typing FUN !!
customer_reviews.text: I am not going to bore you with the 'techno garble' about this keyboard and will simply say I LOVE IT and you probably will too. I am not super fast at typing nor am I a "hunt and peck." This keyboard makes typing FUN! Reminiscent of the old IBM keyboards in the 90s. Beautifully crafted and strong aluminum top plate. It is a bit noisy with wonderful 'spring back' feeling from the keys. The backlit keys are blue LED only and brightness is adjustable for viewing in any light condition. It is not necessary to hit the keys dead center like on membrane keyboards - less mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Key lights started going out...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard, especially the loud clicking feedback from every keypress. It was delivered quickly, in good condition (unlike some other reviewers), and I've had no issues with it interfering with my PCs performance. But, multiple key lights started going out after just a few weeks. Luckily, I stopped typing and came straight to Amazon. Today was the last day to return the keyboard! I decided to request an exchange, instead of a return. Like I said, I really like the keyboard. Hopefully, the replacement is more reliable. I'll update this review if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Worshipper20

customer_reviews.title: Strong mechanical keyboard with pleasant lighting
customer_reviews.text: Great solid mechanical keyboard. Nice and loud with a metal chassis and well-defined key action. Complaint: Shift symbols for main keyboard number row are squeezed next to the numbers , slightly darker and hard to make out. Since a trained typist vaguely needs the lighting to orient this isn't a major issue... just requires a squint if one wants the $ out of turn, for example.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Oconnor

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty And Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is syrprisingly well built. The metal backing plate is solid. The keys are fast to respond. It's noisy, but that's to be expected from a mechanical keyboard. The only big issue I noticed is, if you touch it and give off a static discharge, you'll incapacitate the keyboard momentarily. So, if that's a concern, make sure you ground yourself!
customer_reviews.author: justjoe

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. It's nice and clicky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for work. I really like it. It's nice and clicky. I thought I would have prefered the MX Green type switches which are said to be heavier and I've tried out at my local big brand store. The Otemu blues in this keybroard are supposedly quite lighter. I'm not sure how they compare to the MX Greens personally because I havent gone back to trying any other keyboard since this one came it.The back light is quite nice. I dont care much for it but I have realised that I prefer to have it on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Shearwood

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time, arrived in good shape and is a good quality product. Both the back lighting and the feel of the keyboard are great, just as described or maybe even better! Will post later regarding the durability, but expect that to get a five star rating as well. It is not super quiet to use, but was not advertised or expected to be that, it is a mechanical keyboard with great feedback and response time,.. which is what I was after. Worth five stars !
customer_reviews.author: ratrider

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value for a mechanical cherry mx blue keyboard. It does not have quite the same 'feel' or key consistency as my much more expensive Razer keyboard, but it works fine. If I did not have both keyboards sitting side by side (one for a work station, one for personal...both used often) I might not be able to tell the difference. Definitely won't go wrong with it. I do not use for gaming so cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I really like this kekyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had been having trouble with an old keyboard because it didn't have a clicky sound and I didn't get any feedback if I hit an extra key. I touch type and depend on the clicks so I was making a lot of mistakes some of which I didn't catch. Also the keys on my old keyboard were too close together and I could hit the wrong key w/o being aware. So, I'm doing much better now. I'm not a gamer so I can't speak that issue. I would buy it again of something happened to this.
customer_reviews.author: Professor JB, Baruch

customer_reviews.title: But it feels soooooooooo nice to type on
customer_reviews.text: This thing is loud. I mean REAL loud. The only thing i can compare it to would be remembering the old IBM selectric typewriters I learned to type on back in the early 1980's. Doesn't bother me. Might bother someone else. But it feels soooooooooo nice to type on. I wish I had more to type. This would have been perfect to type out papers while I was in school. LED backlighting is cheezy. Keyboard fonts are odd, but i don't look at the keyboard while I type anyways. If you want something nice to pound on this is the keyboard at a great price. check it out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: A bad experience with this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had only used this for about an hour & all was fine until I restarted my PC. At the logon screen, when I typed the 1st character, suddenly the keyboard started typing a series of c's and 0s faster than I could delete them. I could not clear these because more c0c0c0c0c0c's were continually typed in without me even touching the keyboard. I was locked out of my PC and had to shut down and plug my old keyboard back in, in order to use my computer. I have used many different keyboards over the years & have never had this happen before
customer_reviews.author: P. Parent

customer_reviews.title: Second time is a winner
customer_reviews.text: The first keyboard that was sent to me did not work at all. I would plug it in and nothing worked no lights and would give an error stating it was an unknown device. I had to return it and had to wait for a refund and purchase another one. I decided to give it a second chance and the next one I was sent worked perfectly. I plugged it in and automatically the system detected it. It is a great looking keyboard and great for the price. A little loud but so far so good. Rating it 4 due to the inconvenience of getting that first faulty one.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Negrete

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's a keyboard and it's responsive. It seems to work ok, as I'm typing on it now. It starts off VERY loud and the triggers have a tendency to repeat keystrokes FAST. I can't tell if it's me or the keyboard, but letters and spacebars tend to double up a lot and I've never had that with any other mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Secti0n31

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! Definite buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that I wouldn't like it as I was told that this keyboard would be very clicky. I was absolutely wrong. Upgrading from a Dell OEM PS/2 keyboard from 2001, I ended up with the most tactile and best feeling keyboard for typing. I bought one for my dad and he loves it better than the one he was previously using. I think this keyboard will last me some years and I don't regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pjfreedom

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite budget friendly gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for gaming and typing essays, this is a great product for its price. I got mine with blue LED backlighting and blue switches, but I believe they have more options. I think this is a great bargain if you are looking for a cheap gaming keyboard. Sadly I did have to get a replacement because the first one didn't work. Something might have happened during shipping, but the replacement was perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew keel

customer_reviews.title: Way too dim.
customer_reviews.text: The blue back-lighting of the keys is very dim. The blue light is so dim that some of the key-tops look like Black on Black. I find myself staring at the keys to try and see which is which. This keyboard does not work for me, Maybe white back-lighting will work better. Very disappointed. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Good, but loud for office use.
customer_reviews.text: I like it quite a bit, but think my coworkers don’t like the noise. It’s really loud for office use. It would be hard in a true cubical situation, I’m borderline with having it in my own office. I really like the amount of travel in the keys compared to the membrane keyboard my work IT gave me. It’s a great value and I enjoy using it. It’s probably going to just be my first mechanical board before I spring for a nice one with quiet key switches. The loud clickity clacks are quite satisfying when angrily typing out that nasty email or writing a work critique.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: SO MANY positives but unfortunately one deal breaker for me
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited to receive this keyboard. At first sight it seemed to be exactly what I had been looking for - attractive blue backlighting, numeric keypad on the right, large comfortable keys, big letters, backlighting does not distract from the keys. Then I started typing on it and my heart sank : The keys are REALLY loud! Honestly I didn't even know what that meant. I saw a few reviews stating the same but honestly (and sorry folks) I thought they must be super picky people. I stand corrected. I'm sorry to say, I had to return this otherwise very attractive keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Yamiletlee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is absolutely amazing and it feels great as well. It's extremely durable and looks amazing. If you don't like loud keyboards however, this isn't the one for you. The keyboard only comes with 2 light settings, breathing, and static. You can also increase or decrease the speed of the breathing option. You can use this keyboard with both Mac and Windows. I've had this keyboard for more than around 6 months and it's still holding up. The A and 1 key on the keypad sometimes doesn't work, but I think it's just something messing with MY keyboard and isn't something you should worry about. Overall, it's a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good !
customer_reviews.text: It is not an ergonomic keyboard but si like it. I don't play computer games. I only use it for normal school work. I like the fact that it is illuminated and that I can see all the keys characters when lights are off at my place. So far, I like it. Delivered on time and looks nice and seems to promise to work for long time.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: I love this, best impulse buy
customer_reviews.text: I have a job that I work from home on my computer all day. I like a keyboard with a high relief of keys (the keys stand tall and are not flat against the background). the blue background is soft to the eyes. When the computer goes into sleep the keyboard stays lit. I live my impulse buy! I also really like the sound they keys makes. Easy to type on. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CINDY C.

customer_reviews.title: Solidly build, inexpensive, nice back lighting... pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price. It's a bit on the noisy side, due to the mechanical switches used in the keyboard, but that's not unusual for this type of product. I've heard louder. Nice tactile feel, and it's easy to type on. No issues with the back lighting, which I find very useful, and is the main reason I bought this keyboard. I do game from time to time, but it was the back lighting that I was looking for, so I could better see the keys in darker environments.
customer_reviews.author: S. LEECH

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, so far. I’m an IT professional and use this every day for work. The switches feel great and have a good tactile feel, similar to Cherry MX Blue. You will probably need to install dampeners, if this is being used in an office environment. Not because of the switch's click, though. The keys bottom out on the case and you hear a pretty loud metal sound that reverberates (only way I can describe it). This is a non-issue for me, because I read about this in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Like The Old IBM Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to find an old IBM PC keyboard because I loved the feel of those old boards. This was a far more affordable and modern option. I love the spring action on the keys. It's the closest thing I have found to the IBM board. It feels and sounds good. The blue light is unnecessary to me but, whatever, it's cute.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn H

customer_reviews.title: too much noise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inexpensive backlit keyboard as a backup to my primary backlit keyboard. This keyboard seems sturdy. And the back lighting is good. Perhaps this style of individual mechanical keys might be repairable? I don't know about that idea. Unfortunately the keyboard is very loud and I can't stand to use it. So it has become a backup keyboard to another quieter keyboard which has not failed. If you need a keyboard that will drive your room mates crazy, this is the keyboard to buy. If you and your room mates are literally deaf, this might work for you, but I wouldn't recommend it for anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: David Zingg

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mechanical keyboard at a fraction of the cost of the high end models, it is responsive, has a great feel and is precise. After using membrane keyboards for so long, there was a learning curve because the keys sit higher but once mastered, it is a great keyboard to use for everyday and gaming. Best part is that if this dies in a year, it is still more cost effective because I can get 3 of these for the price of some of the others out there
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Finally TYPING again.
customer_reviews.text: I had forgotten what it felt like to really type. The shape of the keys under my finger tips and sound of clicking and clacking make all the difference in having confidence in typing. After switching to this keyboard I do not have the constant need to stop and make sure I didn’t mistype a letter.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Clicky Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Really nice mechanical keyboard for the price. Clicky Blue Switches (which are loud, but they feel really good to type on), and a really nicely built keyboard. It’s not the best at going to sleep after locking the machine, but I’ve had it for a few months and it’s been great. It looks really sleek, and I would recommend this Keyboard to anyone looking for a clicky blue switch.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Everything I ever wanted in a keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I make my living transcribing from home, so this has been a godsend. MUCH more sturdy and durable than the kind you find at Walmart, and more attractive too. I've been hammering away at it for several months now and all the keyboard letters are visible and intact - no wearing away which has been a massive problem in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for about a month now and I have to say it feels really good to type on. The clicks are very loud and the keys take a lot of force to actuate. The back lighting is great. It glows blue. There is not much to say about the light. I have noticed after a month of heavy use everyday for hours that the keys have begun to wear out. The switches are fine, but the keys have been smoothed out and used. Anti ghosting works also. Great costumer service also. I would recommend this keyboard to anyone who wanted a good quality keyboard for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE COST. FEELS PREMIUM!!
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed and im writing this with the keyboard. so im liking it very much. blue ilumination is great. yes can turn on/off. keys click very well. metal face makes it feel more exspensive and high end. this is however my first mechanical keyboard but def wont be my last. For the price id say yes its worth it and seems like is should hold up for years to come. hope to find a compatable wrist rest for it soon.
customer_reviews.author: David murff

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The #3 on the 10 key pad and the left shift key only respond after repeated clicks. I pried the keys off and saw nothing to clean. Underneath looks clean as new. This was used on my wifes computer so it's not like it was being used 8 hours a day. Disappointing that it has these issues so soon when a standard cheap Dell keyboard can go for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Admindude

customer_reviews.title: Dead keys after a month
customer_reviews.text: Pretty unhappy with the durability. Purchase and used as my work keyboard for approximately a month. Worked great and loved the metal frame, solid key response and tactile feel but started getting dead keys. Very unhappy with the outcome for a product I was enthusiastic about and recommend to multiple co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The very fastest typist keyboard available today, I think.
customer_reviews.text: This have a nice loud click for feedback and a tactile snap under each finger; I feel that these keyboards (EagleTec) are the very fastest typist keyboard available today, I think. I own four at this point, and have created a bit of keyboard envy among my family / friends / co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J Bolling

customer_reviews.title: Started off great.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this keyboard, the firm click and the back-light was just what I needed with mild vision problems. Seems like ive only had this keyboard for a few months and now it almost never works. The biggest issue I have now is that it thinks there are keys pressed all the time. The 1 year warranty might be good but i have to pay almost half what it cost to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a low cost mechanical keyboard this is a great option. It is fairly loud (which doesn't bother me) and that comes down to the type a switches used. I dont think they use Cherry switches, which is probably why it is so inexpensive, but I have been using it for several months and have been extremely satisfied with its performance. The build on it is impressive for the cost as well. There is a metal base layer under the keys, and plastic on the bottom. It has a significant weight to it that keeps it quite stable. Legs are small be well designed. I dont think this keyboard will break for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want the loudest switches, you found the right place
customer_reviews.text: I do want to preface this with saying I did end up returning it, HOWEVER, not due to the manufacturers fault, I simply underestimated how loud exactly it was going to be. The switches felt great as I was quick leaning in Rainbow Six Siege or outjuking a Stage 3 Michael Myers in Dead by Daylight. If you or your buddies dont mind the huge noise, or your mic setup cancels it out, this is by far the best bang for the buck mechanical keyboard out there, just a tad bit too loud for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Imperial

customer_reviews.title: TOO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: Solid and nicely made. Way, way too loud, it's disturbing. Can't use when I'm on the phone. The tactile feedback is a little too stiff and hurts my fingers. The labels on the keys are weird, kind of like the helm on a Klingon battle cruiser. Had to return. Why can't there be one decent keyboard for those who program but are not Gamers?
customer_reviews.author: Howard S. in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Quite loud as expected. I've had mine coming up on 2 years now. all the keys still work as they should. a few of the LED's behind the keys have burned out or dimmed. the 5, 9, Y, M keys are noticeably dimmer than the others. but for 30 something bucks. really cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: TRN99

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Still works great. Since theres space between each key you have to clean the keyboard (specially if you have pets with hair), its not really a problem though. Its feels smooth, and has that nice cherry blue clicking sound. Beware, it sounds laud, which i really like, but it can be a problem if you are in a place that cant make much noise. Have used it for gaming and for university stuff (which involve lots of typing). great product, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Del Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard, perfect for office use
customer_reviews.text: Sheesh, this is a fun keyboard to use. I have been typing for years on a typical "throw away" Dell or HP keyboard, with the keys getting more and more worn down with each month of use, and food stuck all over the edges. Anyway, I bought this as a treat for all the long hours I have been pulling, and it's completely worth it. The typing is just less exhausting and more fun; I think it goes faster too. Anyway, I highly recommend it for use in the office. No need to waste a good keyboard like this on just gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Bass guy

customer_reviews.title: Edit: keys are failing after 3 years, but when it worked it was great
customer_reviews.text: Edited after 3 years of near constant use: Keys finally started failing, the 'C' and 'Q' have become very inconsistent. Subtracting one star for each key. To clarify the sound that other people are mentioning: Typing on this keyboard sounds exactly like there is a roomful of people with Bic retractable pens nervously clicking them in and out repeatedly. I love it, you might not. Love the sound and feel of the keyboard. Beats every cheap comes-with-the-computer peripheral I've ever used, and is better than the excellent keyboard on my Lenovo laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Soiland

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard but if you run two monitors...
customer_reviews.text: The EagleTec KG010 seems to be a very quality keyboard for the money the keys are very responsive and all they need is a light touch. The only thing I find a bit unhandy is if you run two monitors and watch video on one monitor you have to click back to the video for and adjustment to sound, etc. I do wish it had a dedicated volume control. Like I say you have to click on the video every time to make a video adjustment unless I have missed a feature so far. Just got it today. But I do like it and do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I love how this keyboard feels and the color is just right. The only complaint I have is that they keystrokes are extremely noisy. There is an echo sound as well as the mechanical keyboard sound. This is much noisier than other mechanical keyboards I have used. I am hoping I get used to the sound because other than that I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Jenson

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly great keyboard!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am really really shocked at how well made and how much I love this keyboard! I had an older logitech keyboard that I had to retire because the enter key was going out. I had that keyboard for about 10 yrs and was sad to see it go. This new EagleTec KG010 Gaming keyboard though is amazing. I can't believe how responsive it is! I was really worried about getting a keyboard for such a cheap price, considering I had paid over 100$ for my logitech years ago. If you are on the fence about buying this keyboard , take the plunge.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is and it's a moot point, but the clicking of the keys is a little loud. I realize it is a mechanical keyboard so that comes with the territory. It's also possible that it will lesson over time and use. I really like the color and helps when typing in a dark room. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Wish more “springy” touch; but EXCELLENT sounding 1980's keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: In a perfect world, I wish that it had more of a "springy" touch and response on the up-stroke return (like the spring of a manual typewriter that pushes back after you type). While I don’t know if keyboards like that exist(?) I can say that the down-stroke “click” acoustics are EXCELLENT! The cubed shape of the plastic keys took me back to the 1980’s. It has that classic word processor feel & sound (think when Tom Hanks types in 'Big') + with 2020 LEDs! I recommend (and it is loud)!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.P.

customer_reviews.title: The actual keys illuminate!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a night owl like I am maybe you can get up and check your emails late night and like myself have not memorize the keys on a keyboard yet probably never this is the keyboard you want to get! It is excellent! A lights up each key letters included and backlight also. If you want a economical low price keyboard that helps you find the keys at night buy this one now!!
customer_reviews.author: Braulio Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price. Lighter than average switches.
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprisingly great keyboard for the price. The back is completely metal, the backlighting works great, and the switches are definitely blue switches. One thing to keep in mind is that these switches are a bit lighter than your average blue switch meaning that it takes less force to press them down, it's a personal preference to how light you want your switches, but these are perfect for me typing all day. The only complaint I have is that the angle and front of the keyboard mean that you are almost required to have a wrist rest, when you have one it works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: What good value
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these keyboards I’ve purchased! They are loud and will piss off the buddies on discord, but very easy to type on. Powers right up and sturdy! Ordered this second one for my second computer I have purchased. Good job guys. Great keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Danman0614

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found this earlier.
customer_reviews.text: I am a software programmer. Live and breath all day on keyboard and a little game during off hours when the wife allows it. I tried a bunch of different mechanical keyboards, Corsair K70 (red, then brown, then blue), Logitech G610, and few other brands. I returned them all due to either price is way too high or annoying backlit light features. Finally this KG010. This one is a keeper. For $40 or less, it's just right. Clicky and feels just right. Simple blue backlit. Nothing fancy, nothing annoying...exactly how I want it. Plug it into my macBook Pro, change the modifier setting in my mac for the external keyboard...BAMMM done. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tien N.

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built and very noisy!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the keyboard. It is solid and seems to be well made. The blue backlight is nice. However, it is the noisiest keyboard I have ever heard! If I am on a call, the typing is so loud, it distracts others on the call. Finally, I am have fairly large hands, but will need to buy a wrist rest to accompany the keyboard because the keys are very tall.
customer_reviews.author: John Oberdiek

customer_reviews.title: Rattley
customer_reviews.text: The keys are set higher than most keyboards, and click loudly when depressed. Makes for a noisy typing session. Do NOT like that at all! Not sure how long the keyboard will last, as it feels lightweight and flimsy. I'll try it for a while, but I suspect I will end up replacing it, because the noise is distracting and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: moo dog

customer_reviews.title: Loved it right up until it died
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June of 2018, now April 2020 RIP. Not quite 2 years lifespan, Not impressed with that. While it was alive, it was a very nice mechanical keyboard. Loved the backlighting and the satisfying click while typing. Sad to bury my friend.
customer_reviews.author: KATHRYN A BOVA

customer_reviews.title: No Instructions, No Customer Support, Just have to wing it alone!
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was a Backlit Mechanical Keyboard and surely wasn't going to spend over $100 for it. This isn't a bad keyboard by any means, but why didn't you just include instructions for non-gamers? No manual, no support, no service. Lucky to have gamer friends that answered my questions.
customer_reviews.author: USTNOTE

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard if you don't mind a little noise....
customer_reviews.text: Been giving this thing a good workout for a few days and am very pleased with it. Solidly made, good touch and I love the blue lighted keys. It does "clack" since it's mechanical (which might not work in an office environment with others nearby) but this is for my home system and the noise doesn't bother me a bit. Been using Logitech 360 wireless boards for the past few years but they just don't last. Great "gamer" type board but geared for office work.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clicky keyboard for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this keyboard when I bought it, but... Am I ever happy with it! It's huge... and beefy. LOL. It feels like the old school keyboards that I used to use back in the day. I like the look and feel of it, and I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for a pretty inexpensive clicky keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Very close to a Das keyboard professional
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard feel although a tad loud. I was using a Das Pro but it failed within a year and the company ignored me when I contacted them for the 3-year warranty. This new keyboard is just about as good for a tiny fraction of the DAS keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Rexford

customer_reviews.title: Ecxellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was exactly as specified and functions perfectly. It is a very positive step up from my mushy bubble type keyboard and has improved my typing considerably due to the tactile and audible feedback. The audible feedback is fairly loud so may be annoying to others nearby but still is a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: barbara l

customer_reviews.title: Lights burn out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice heavy keyboard but I have only been using it for about a month and three of the lights under the keys have burned out. I don't expect the rest to last very long. Its unfortunate because the keyboard has a lot of potential! It has been a year of light use and the whole thing is complete rubbish. Some keys don't register while other type a whole bunch of them when only pressed once. I am bummed, as I enjoy the cherry blue the most!
customer_reviews.author: BBQ_POPE

customer_reviews.title: Cool appearance, outstanding clicky keys, but the legs are deficient. Not sure whether she's a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the keyboard looks elegant, the blue lighting is cool, and the keys have an excellent touch. However, the fold-out legs to prop it up are too short and don't stay extended. Unless you have the keyboard lying completely flat (not propped by the legs) it's going to slide around. Lot of positives but I'm on this thing 14 hours a deal, so not sure she's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Great Big Weg

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully crafted, wonderful feel
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a great mechanical keyboard at an outstanding price. I'm able to type much more quickly and accurately than I have on any other keyboard in the recent past. I love the clickety click sound and tactile feedback. The keyboard is rock solid. It has a very hefty feel which just feels good in your hands. Keys are beautifully back-lit with a soft blue light. I have wanted one of these for a long time, but they have always been price prohibitive. I use this for work, but will be buying a second one for my home computer.
customer_reviews.author: davyboy

product_meta.title: Eagletec KG010 Mechanical Keyboard Clicky Blue Switch Equivalent Wired Ergonomic Office Keyboard, Steel Aluminum Series Blue LED RGB Backlit with 104 Keycaps for Windows PC Home or Business (Black)
feature_bullets: Gaming Keyboard for Home or Office the EagleTec KG010 with 104 Keys and Dust Proof Blue Switches (Cherry MX Blue equivalent) Clicky, medium resistance, audible loud click sound, crisp precise tactile feedback, good for typing and gaming
Blue LED Backlit Mechanical Keyboard offering 9 different Backlighting and Brightness Modes the precision engineered keycaps offering crystal clear lettering that doesn't scratch off

Aircraft Grade Aluminum Abs Construction the PC Gaming Keyboard is constructed of Aircraft-Grade Aluminum and ABS with plate-mounted mechanical keys and switches that stand up to tough gaming conditions

Ergonomic Keyboard, Anti Ghosting All 104 mechanical keys are conflict free (n-Key Rollover), Non-Slip Ergonomic Spill Proof Design. Full Size with number pad, Multimedia Keys, WASD Arrows Key Exchange, Lockable Windows key

USB Mechanical Keyboard with lights Compatibility Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP, Limited Mac OS keyboard support. Works well with all major Computers Brands and Gaming PCs MSI, Dell, Corsair, Alienware, Razer, PS4, Xbox One, Asus and others

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,144 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
